greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let p = A046133(n), that is, let p run through the list of primes such that p+12 is also prime (A046133); a(n) = number of primes in the interval p + 1 through p + 11 inclusive.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: For n=1, we have p=5, the primes between 5 and 5+12=17 are 7,11,13, so a(1)=3.
maple: for n from 1 to 200 do if isprime(ithprime(n)+12) then
for i from 1 to 11 do if isprime(ithprime(n)+i) then c:=c+1; fi; od;
mathematica: cp[x_,y_] := Count[Table[PrimeQ[i],{i,x,y}],True]; d = 12; Do[s = Prime[n]; If[PrimeQ[s+d], Print[cp[s+1,s+d-1]]], {n, 1, 1000}]
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 29 2003
ext: Definition edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 05 2017 following analysis by _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 30 2017
